creditline: Gift of Richard L. Simmons in memory of Roberta Grodberg Simmons
department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: not sewn at sides, white ground with highly stylized zoomorphic figures primarily in purple with accents in red, blue, green. Lower half has five narrow rows of small bird and animal figures; upper half has larger purple birds (chickens or turkeys?) with red bands and diamond patterns. simple randa joins two panels, neckline is round-cut with ties. Embroidered inscription refers to Chuarranch, date, possibly makers.
markings: \'Manuel Chocon/Marina Kajap Chuarrancho 1967-7 Oct. Primer Espiritu Sante...(Illegible)\'
title: Woman's blouse (Huipil)
